meanings.definition: To view or present in a sentimental way.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys sentimentalizing old photographs of her family.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't help sentimentalizing the memories of his childhood.
meanings.sent3: The movie about talking animals had everyone sentimentalizing their pets.
meanings.sent4: Her paintings have a way of sentimentalizing even the simplest scenes.
meanings.sent5: The author's words had a magical way of sentimentalizing everyday moments.

meanings.definition: To indulge in or exhibit sentimentality.
meanings.sent1: They spent the evening sentimentalizing over their favorite songs.
meanings.sent2: The grandmother couldn't resist sentimentalizing about the good old days.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends ended up sentimentalizing about their high school prom.
meanings.sent4: The artist's work beautifully sentimentalizes the bond between mother and child.
meanings.sent5: The movie's soundtrack sentimentalized the emotional journey of the main character.
